main event: On February 6, 1955, in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, a bright object was observed flashing away to the south for a duration of 2nd. The sighting was classified as a Ground-Visual type.
interesting points: The observation was made by a pilot of the Flight 939 - Flying Tigers, suggesting credible witnesses.
The object was observed flashing away to the south with no further details available.
The report concludes with possibilities including 'Was Balloon', 'Was Aircraft', 'Was Astronomical Meteor', among others, indicating uncertainty in identifying the object.
No photographs or other evidence were present to further evaluate the sighting.
The report was obtained from the control tower at Harrisburg PA airport, but the identity of the pilot who reported the UFO is unknown.
sighted object: a bright object flashing away to the south
witnesses: the pilot of Flight 939 - Flying Tigers
